name: Beiler's Donuts
categories: Food, Donuts, Coffee & Tea, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt

text: I had an order from here twice. The first time I was being a little fat and got 12. I like to order things in sets of twos (OCD much)? No, but I have a sister and daughter so they can try one and I try the other. We're they good? Hell yea! The second time my friend dropped me off 4 donuts because what are friends for? ! I don't know I think this might be my new spot even though I'm a certified Krispy Kreme girl.

Good donuts! Many flavors to choose and all have their own distinct taste. I prefer the glazed cake donuts. They have a soft cake like consistency and are basically old fashion donuts with glaze on top. They are very dense. The Blueberry Fritters and Lemon Creme are a must try. So delicious, full of blueberries and lemon flavors. Donuts are also very affordable at $15.25 for a dozen and $8.00 for a half dozen.
Fresh and delicious, although you have a plethora of options, pick up a filled donut (preferably a citrus flavor)

Did you even go to Philly if you didn't stop at Beilers for the doughnuts. They have endless number of options to pick from that it can be overwhelming sometimes. Personal favorite are the White chocolate MnM and Fruity Pebble doughnuts. If you have a favorite, definitely recommend getting the big birthday doughnut but you have to order in advance.

I went to the Beiler's Donuts in Reading Terminal and got a dozen donuts. They have a huge variety of doughnuts, and I had the Blueberry Fritter, Caramel Apple, and the French Crueller. They were pretty standard doughnuts that were sweet, with nothing negative to say about them, so my impression is that they are very popular for the variety of doughnuts they offer.
Best donuts in Phildelphia. Always stop at Beiler's when we are in town. The fritters are my favorite but everything is good.

On Saturday, 9/25 we stopped by to pick up a large chocolate cream pie to take up to college to celebrate our daughter's 20th bday.  This pie is her favorite so we made sure to take extra care to make sure it was cold and intact despite our 4 hour ride.  Unfortunately when we went to take a bite, after singing happy birthday, the cream was curdled and the pie rancid.  We were shocked & so disgusted each of us 5 had to spit it out!  Luckily my daughter has a sense of humor bec this mom felt terrible about it.  So disappointing!
Quick & efficient with getting people in & out. Aesthetically delicious. The perfect sweet tooth craving fix.
So good, I forgot to take picture up until I only had a bite left. Staff was extremely friendly and the line was long but it moved quickly. Once again, one of the best donuts I ever had
Some of the best quality and most creative donuts you'll ever have. Nice shop in the University City area with some limited indoor seating. A must visit when in Philly.

I had read and heard so much about Beiler's Donuts, that I had to stop in when I was in the area.  I came in expecting long lines, but I was fortunate enough to be the only one in the shop on a Friday mid-morning.

I ordered a half dozen donuts to take to a friend over at Presbyterian Hospital.  Her family unanimously claimed them to be the "best donuts in Philly."  That might have been influenced by the fact that I told them Beiler's is credited to be the "best donuts in Philly" when I gifted them the box.  

After my visit to the hospital, I picked up a Chocolate Iced for myself and a Sea-salt Caramel for my husband.  I have to admit, the donuts are pretty darn good. 

Donut Pricing: $1.50 each, $8 Half Dozen, $15.25 Dozen
Best Donuts I have ever had - especially the Blueberry Fritter. They have so many delicious options. And the staff is super friendly.

I ordered the peanut butter s'mores donut. It had a white marshmallow filling, topped with chocolate, crushed graham crackers, and a s'more. The peanut butter flavor was minimal, almost nonexistent. The donut was soft and fresh, but not melt in your mouth. I would probably try something else if I go back, but this is a perfect donut for you if you love marshmallows. 

The service was fast and friendly. The line takes quite a while to move due to people trying to decide which donuts they will be ordering.

Better than the original location (if that's possible) - I came here on Friday afternoon right when they were closing, having called in to ask them to save a few of the original donuts for me.  Not only did they honor the request, but the staff was polite and highly professional as well.  They were friendly and knowledgeable about the offerings, and got me trying a new donut as well, something I had not done previously. 

The premises were clean and well-maintained, and unlike the original location, there's designated seating that's well-maintained too. 

They also have coffee!

Great customer service - they drew a smiley face on my box too!!  Will be back!

Always a delicious treat and better than other places with a reputation for fancy donuts (looking at you federal) but much better than the others and significantly cheaper. Example, average donuts last weekend from federal was $27, these amazing donuts from Beilers, $15

Don't sleep on their classics either like cream filled, glazed, and apple filled. All amazing

Good for people who: want a variety of tasty doughnuts to binge eat when you're stressed from school 
Bad for people who: are worried about their sugar intake 

As far as doughnuts go, Beiler's is pretty good. They have a ton of good flavors and it seems like theres always a new flavor that you haven't gotten around to trying yet. The staff were really nice when I went to go pick up my nuts. I got half a dozen for my friends and I to share and we had a lot of fun trying to cut open the nuts as if they were egg yolks on top of toast or something (as you can see from the videos it's definitely not as dramatic as cutting into a yolk). My favorite is the fruity pebbles chocolate doughnut. While I'm still a federal donuts girl at heart, I'm down for Beiler's anytime.

I was too close not to stop! Beiler's is a staple in Philly and a must try if your near by. I grabbed a half dozen before heading out of the city. They were totally worth the 20 minute detour and the $12 parking. The strawberry shortcake was my favorite

wanted to try federal donuts but they were closed due to covid hours so we ended up stopping in beiler's donuts.

* the staff: kind, helpful, patient

* dining area: jan. 2020 there wasn't any indoor dining so we just picked up some donuts to take home

* what i ordered:
- a dozen donuts (can't remember which ones we got exactly) - these donuts were thick and airy, not dry or hard at all! we were so happy that this impulsive stop for donuts was so delicious.

summary: 10/10 highly recommend. i guarantee you will find something here that you'll like. make sure to get there early so that they don't sell out of the flavors you want!

Melt-in-your-mouth donuts! The line of people waiting to buy the donuts says it all. These donuts are awesome!

Loaded with all the goodness....butter cream sugar, so don't count calories when you are here! Because you will not know how many of them you inhaled in 2 mins!

We tried apply fritter, mocha, pumpkin spice, apply cider, oreo cream, red velvet and maple glaze. My fav (because I am  not a fan of cream filled donuts) was apple cider. Mocha was equally yummy.

If in this Philly area, Reading Terminal Market is a must try. And don't leave the market before you treat yourself with a donut from here!

I have had Beiler's for the last 5 years and is one of my top donut shops. The best part is the texture of the donuts - it's chewy but airy and not cakey/dense. And the flavors are delicious and decadent. And for the price point it is amazing for about 1 dollar a donut it's better quality and price then the NYC Donuts I have tried. 

Favorites: my friends love the apple/blueberry fritters, I like the salted caramel, maple cream, and strawberry cake

I ordered a dozen doughnuts for delivery about 10 minutes before they closed up for the day. Unfortunately you all had run out of a few of the donuts I asked for. Instead you sent an assortment of 2 dozen doughnuts! Very much appreciated, and we still got our favorite doughnuts in the assortment. Everything was delicious.
There are some many varieties donuts!  And I do like many of them!  Chocolate moose, nutella, pumpkin spice (seasonal), triple chocolate, and so on!  Worth to try and very good service!

Heard these were some of the best donuts in the city so had to check them out. They offer of variety and specialty donuts. They are the best, no doubt. You'll find glazed donuts and the usual favorites. Then you'll find the non-usual type of donuts, like M&M donuts, Fruity Pebbles donuts and so much more. Fresh batches made daily and often. You'll smell them once you enter Reading Terminal. Get yourself some sugary sweet treats!

$12.99 for a dozen high quality donuts?? Yes please!

Donuts are thick and fluffy--the perfect texture. It gives a good bite but also melts in your mouth. They have a variety of different donuts, from the classics like glazed and chocolate sprinkled to the seasonal ones like peppermint bark to my favorites like the apple fritters. There are so many choices that it can make anyone have a favorite to choose from. I loved the fall flavors, like pumpkin pie and harvest apple. However, the caramel apple was the best. The filling was like apple pie filling, so it was so moist. I am also a fan of the Nutella and Oreo, however, the filling is the white cream. I wish there was Nutella filling or a cookies and cream filling. The PB and J donut is also really good. I like the contrast between the PB creme and the fresh jam. I wasn't the biggest fan of the cereal donuts, however. The cereal, like fruity pebbles and lucky charms, would not retain the crunch on the donut. The lemon donut was also decent, but too sour for my liking. Overall, it's definitely a good place to get some fancy donuts for a good price!

This review is going to be short and sweet because it's all about donuts and basically everyone knows that Beiler's has some of the best around. Personally, I like to keep it simple with my sweets. So I'm partial to the chocolate-frosted, cream-filled donuts or basic glazed/frosted. If you do like different flavors and toppings, there's definitely plenty of those to choose from as well. 

The donuts are perfectly sized so you can enjoy one for breakfast without feeling like you blasted through half a day's calories. An excellent treat for these trying times!
Antoine was super friendly and knowledgeable. He provided a great customer experience. Loved this cute place and the Nutella donut!

this review is for the 39th street location. I'm closer to the reading terminal market but with the covid, it's a little too crowded there with locals and tourists for my taste. Even before the corona, it was always too crowded. I motored over and parked which wasn't too hard because school isn't back in full swing because of the virus. Beautiful store with high ceilings and a welcoming vibe. I got the powdered vanilla creme donut. Very tasty. The counter person suggested the fritter next time which I saw another customer ask for two of and read in other reviews. I'd go back.

Beiler's is my go to donut spot in University City. There are multiple other locations (Lancaster and Reading Terminal) as well. Note that their hours have adjusted because of COVID and it's limited to takeout only. I noticed that the store has been much cleaner recently as well. 

The store has good donuts for a reasonable price. One donut is $1.30, half a dozen is $6.99, and a dozen is $12.99. There's a large variety to choose from but I find that lately a lot of the flavors that I like aren't available. I think it really depends on the time of day you go. I love the flavor combinations, however Beiler's donuts tend to be on the sweeter side. My favorite donut is hands down the blueberry fritter.

TLDR: If you have a sweet tooth, this is the place for you. Good donuts at a great price!

This is such a cute little donut shop! Tons of selection to choose from. We got a half dozen with some good fall flavors: apple cider donuts, pumpkin donuts and blueberry fritters. Everything was so tasty and I can't wait to try more of the others. The staff was so friendly too. We are definitely coming back and highly recommend!

These doughnuts never disappoint and always make me say..."KrispyKreme WHO?!" My fave is the creek filled glazed. But there are SO MANY that are incredibly delish! I fly in from Seattle frequently and ALWAYS pick one up!

EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED! ZERO STARS!

I have wanted to come here for quite some time now(Took a while because I'm not big on sweets.) given how nice the donuts look online. But boy was I disappointed Let start off with the case. I wish I had taken a photo. It looked HORRIBLE( It looked sooo badd that I almost didn't make a purchase. But I figured I should at least get one thing since I've traveled all this way. So I went with something on the cleanest looking tray.), like the trays should have been switched out and condensed a looooong time ago!


PRESENTATION IS A BIG PART IN MAKING SALES AND HAVING RETURN CUSTOMER'S.

To make matters worse, the donut that I was given (cinnamon sugar cake donut) was REALLY hard. I didn't say anything, thinking maybe it's just because I came later in the day( around 2:30pm) so they'd been sitting out for a while.  And I could just pop it in the microwave to soften it up. WRONG

I should have went with my 1st mine and just gave it back and  walked away.  I put this in the microwave and yes, it did soften up. BUT, almost IMMEDIATELY after, started to harden back up like of ROCK! So I COULDN'T even eat this and wound up wasting my money! I don't know what's in these donuts but there's NO WAY they're scratch made like I was told!

I've made plenty of donuts from scratch and even if they were sitting out ALL DAY. They would NOT be rock hard or harden up after warming them!


Also, your employees were NOT wearing HAIRNETS, GLOVES or FACEMASK!
Went to pick up 3 dozens before work. Staffs are so pleasant. Not a lot of people right before 8am. So many choices of donuts and they're all so good and so fresh!

If you are in the Lancaster, PA area and need a sweet pick me up, order from this place. They deliver all types of flavored donuts from the old fashioned donut to key lime to Nutella. They have deals where you can order a dozen and try different types of donuts and when you order it comes in a nicely sealed box.

These are amazing donuts. There is a nice variety and very sweet, but it's worth it. The apple/blueberry fritters are the bomb, and are so full, fluffy, and soft with their little fruit bits. Highly recommend these donuts. My friend had these catered at her wedding instead of a traditional wedding cake, and it was the best.
Very fresh donuts! I got the Nutella, my husband had the pumpkin, so tasty. There is a lot of selection, just wish I had bought more!

I also love beiler donuts. The donuts are always fresh and the options are endless. The line is always long especially on the weekend but actually, the line does move pretty fast and I do not mind it at all during the weekend.

There are so many favors to choose from and as I said, they are made fresh! Some of the donuts I like are the glazed, peanut butter, and the oreo.The apple fritters are also good. 

The service is also good! Will come back as always!

Oh my lordy. Y'all. These donuts! We only tried two - the maple bacon and the caramel apple donuts. They were so fluffy and perfect!!! There was a good amount of filling in it, which I appreciated! The caramel apple donut was most definitely my favorite donut I've ever had! The maple bacon was definitely great, I just preferred the caramel apple!

New to the area and found this place using Yelp. Since it was wife's birthday, decided to get an assorted dozen. We both LOVED them ! Had an early morning delivery and donuts were so fresh! Some even felt warm! We enjoyed all the different flavors! No more Dunkin for us if we are in Philly! The fritters were amazing and I personally loved the triple chocolate but I am a chocolate lover.

This is, without a doubt, the perfect donut. Pillowy, with enough crunch upon the first bite, and perfectly flavored. And such a fantastic variety! The iced coffee was also excellent, well balanced and rich. The service too was perfect, attentive and immediate, and the store immaculately clean. 

My only request would be to add tip when using Apple Pay, as I've stopped carrying cash due to COVID-19. Will definitely be back and highly recommend!
Great doughnuts! Fresh and homemade. I don't know about others, but I like to taste the real butter in baked good and you can definitely taste it here. The prices were great as well. Paid $7 for 6.

writing a late review since I went here pre-pandemic. These donuts are just the best. It's in reading terminal with a lot of other food options.

You can taste the love and care that went into them. Lots of different varieties and you would probably pay twice the prize for 1/2 the quality in a place like NYC.

If you are looking for donut heaven look no further. . . This place out shines all other donuts forget Dunkin, crispy or another don't waste your time or money. For always fresh, flavorful donuts you have to go to Beilers.

This is a normal stop for me and the donuts no doubt are awesome so these two stars are from the sever lack of customer service I received today 3/19/2020 usually the staff is great quick very receptive and in great spirits and I understand the corno deal going on but if you wanna be rude and nasty and disrespectful in the handling of other people food especially when it ain't no cheap dried up Dunkin  donut orders especially when I drive all the way down to the city for a donut  that usually comes with the upmost in customer service the tall light skin girl with braids and her headphones in today who threw my food around shoving it in a bag when she could of put all four in a plastic container  like every body else making my pretty donuts a sloppy ass mess in a bag to take home to my family cause I got one donut for every one she needs to be coached matter fact just let her go she is toxic for this type of environment

It was a gamble to decide which is good and which is not. The donuts taste were mediocre like Dunkin' Donuts which got them 3 stars, but the staff didn't know what they were talking about. They stated that they didn't have any custard filled donuts but upon eating one, it was full of custard. My recommendation for the donut that pleased me the most was the coconut topping donut. The rest were ehh
The BEST baked goods ever! I dare one to resist the blueberry and apple fritters - my weakness!
This place is amazing. I am a huge donut snob and the location is Reading terminal is always packed. So having on in Ucity that is less busy is GREAT!

Good sitting space with the flavor and attention of the donuts we all love! Consistent quality, this place always has plenty of options to try and your favorites to share. Perfect location to study, drop in before work, or meet up for an awkward conversation. Comfy couches at least, and friendly workers.

YOU GOTTA GET HERE

strong flavorful coffee, the most delicious muffins donuts cakes treats you could get without driving into Lancaster. 

Staff very kind and music is my fav. 

Awesome place, gotta try it

Donuts are fine, hit or miss. I've been once when they were very underdone. Mostly yeast donuts with "exotic" toppings. I have never been and received good service. In fact, I've never even received decent service.

Wow wow wow. The best donuts ever! Worth the trip to come to PA for.

Perfectly doughy and sweet! Super fresh. They are so inexpensive too. You can watch them make them right in front of you. The real deal!
